intro: Puccinellia uchikawae, commonly known as the Japanese glassworts, is a flowering plant species belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in saline or alkaline soils, often found in coastal areas or inland salt flats. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, with a bluish-gray hue due to a waxy coating. Puccinellia uchikawae plays a role in stabilizing soils in harsh environments and is adapted to withstand drought and high salinity.
